attributes.action: ISIS fighters returning to Britain should face a war crimes tribunal.
attributes.background:
Laws are in place to protect our way of life. The government can't pick and choose when to use these laws.

More than 300 British Military personnel are being investigated for crimes in Iraq and Afghanistan.

We expect the government to investigate the 400 plus ISIS of crimes against humanity.

rejection.details:
Trials for war crimes are the responsibility of the International Criminal Court (ICC). You can find out more about the ICC here:

https://www.icc-cpi.int/en_menus/icc/Pages/default.aspx
